image.altText: stock childcare

props.synopsis: For those like me who have been investigating childcare for almost a year now, the news was horrifying but not a surprise.

title.children: Childcare revelations are the stuff of nightmares but I wasn't surprised

image.altText: A close up of Albanese with an Australian map behind him

props.synopsis: The PM's speech comes at a delicate moment in Australia’s key strategic relationship, as the federal government grapples with an unpredictable White House.

title.children: Anthony Albanese to champion 'Australian independence' within US alliance

image.altText: A group of cricketers celebrate a wicket with a batter walking off the field next to them.

props.synopsis: West Indies captain Roston Chase falls victim to a rare successful DRS call by Australia early in the second session on day two of the second Test in Grenada. Follow live.

title.children: West Indies batters up the scoring after dog interrupts play on day two

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: HOPE IS EXTINGUISHED! Cummins breaks through out of nowhere

image.altText: Donald Trump dances in front of a large American flag display.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's mega-bill blew up his bromance with his biggest billionaire backer and could end up costing him considerable political capital. But it also brings his MAGA priorities to life.

title.children: Trump's 'big, beautiful bill' will remake the US in three major ways

image.altText: Patrick Cripps walks off the field with the Carlton players

props.synopsis: Collingwood romps to a convincing win over Carlton at the MCG thanks to a second-half clinic, while GWS completes a big win over West Coast in Perth.

title.children: 'We let our club down tonight': Voss bemoans another horror night for Blues against Pies

image.altText: A boy in a blue shirt walks in front of damaged cars

props.synopsis: Waves of drone and missile attacks targeted Kyiv in the largest aerial attack since Russia's war in Ukraine began.

title.children: Russia hammers Kyiv in largest missile and drone barrage since war began

image.altText: Vanessa Hudson stands in front of Qantas plane, holding a microphone

props.synopsis: Qantas boss Vanessa Hudson apologises to more than 6 million customers for a data breach, saying the airline takes cybersecurity "incredibly seriously".

title.children: Qantas CEO Vanessa Hudson finally fronts a camera, in Athens

image.altText: Brendan Piakura screams

props.synopsis: Canterbury-Bankstown Bulldogs missed the chance to go top of the NRL ladder with a breathtaking capitulation to surrender an 18-0 lead at the 60-minute mark to lose 22-18 against the Brisbane Broncos.

title.children: Broncos complete 'unbelievable' comeback to blow away Bulldogs

image.altText: A man working in a warehouse

props.synopsis: There are about 6,000 Australians who stand to lose $590 million invested with First Guardian following its collapse, as ASIC takes court action against its directors and promoters.

title.children: First Guardian collapse leaves thousands at risk of losing their super

image.altText: An external view of Moriah College

props.synopsis: School children have had eggs thrown at them, been chased down streets and subjected to Nazi salutes and death threats amid a surge of racism targeted at Sydney's Jewish community, a parliamentary inquiry hears.

title.children: Jewish children subject to 'relentless drip-feed of hate', inquiry told

image.altText: A member of staff places the comic book titled 'The Future I saw' on a shelf.

props.synopsis: Japan has seen record numbers of visitors this year. But viral rumours of impending disaster stemming from a comic book prediction have reportedly impacted the tourism boom, with some airlines cancelling flights.

title.children: Decline in tourist numbers to Japan blamed on manga's disaster prediction

image.altText: Julio César Chávez Jr punches Jake Paul with a right hook to the head

props.synopsis: Famed Mexican boxer Julio César Chávez Jr is arrested in the United States just days after he fought influencer-turned-boxer Jake Paul in California.

title.children: ICE arrests Mexican boxer in US days after fight against Jake Paul

image.altText: A silhouette of a hand holds a mobile phone with a blank white screen

props.synopsis: I was transferring my mobile number to a new provider when my phone service cut out. That was my first clue that my identity had been stolen.

title.children: I was a victim of cybercrime. This is what I wished I'd paid attention to

image.altText: The exterior of a mine.

props.synopsis: The troubled Dartbrook coal mine has plunged into receivership and administration just months after it reopened following years of disuse.

title.children: Troubled coal mine enters administration after defaulting on $174m loan

image.altText: A woman applies sunscreen to her arm. A pool can be seen in the background.

props.synopsis: At least eight sunscreens that failed to meet their advertised SPF50 sun protection claims in a recent review had their original tests for certification done by an overseas laboratory whose results are being questioned by industry experts.

title.children: Eight sunscreens that failed their SPF claims tested by same overseas lab

image.altText: Five young women and a man stand together for a photo on a porch

props.synopsis: The man responsible for killing four Idaho university students has struck a plea deal with the prosecution — meaning some questions may never be answered.

title.children: Bryan Kohberger confessed to four murders — he may never have to explain why

image.altText: Diogo Jota looks to the heavens and smiles

props.synopsis: Diogo Jota wasn't Liverpool's best player or the most famous. But he will be immortalised in a song that is proof of how deeply he wove himself into the fabric of the city.

title.children: Through one iconic song, Diogo Jota's legacy will live forever in Liverpool

image.altText: A middle-aged man gestures as he speaks near an industrial site.

props.synopsis: The federal government has committed more than $430 million to help bring large-scale hydrogen production to the New South Wales Hunter region.

title.children: Government doubles down on hydrogen hub amid uncertainty

image.altText: A young man smiling at the camera, wearing a tuxedo as he stands inside a living room.

props.synopsis: NSW Police allege the boys — 17 and 16 — donned dark clothing and approached "innocent" 21-year-old Luke Manassa in Sydney's west last Thursday night.

title.children: Man stabbed in case of 'mistaken identity' contract killing, police say

image.altText: Jess Munday, Labor Candidate for Franklin 2025-07-04 10:07:00

props.synopsis: The Liberals have claimed Unions Tasmania secretary and Labor candidate Jess Munday is ineligible to be elected because of her position on the WorkCover Tasmania board. But Labor has released its own legal advice, prepared by a former solicitor-general, who found Ms Munday would not be ineligible.

title.children: Labor confident Jess Munday is eligible to contest election

image.altText: Usher, wearing a fur coat, sings into a microphone.

props.synopsis: US singer Usher had been due to play 12 arena dates in Sydney and Melbourne towards the end of the year.

title.children: R&B star Usher cancels Australian arena tour without explanation

image.altText: Andy Lee stands behind a stand and microphone in a recording booth with head phones on. His arms are up as he reads a line

props.synopsis: Andy Lee is no stranger to TV, but when it came to turning his best-selling kids' book into a show for the ABC, it was a process unlike anything he had experienced before.

title.children: Andy Lee's desperate plea: Do Not Watch This Show

image.altText: A fatberg pulled out of a pipe in Kwinana.

props.synopsis: Sewer blockages caused by mounds of grease, oils and wet wipes called 'fatbergs' reached foul new heights in Perth, as authorities try to stop people putting foreign objects down sinks and toilets.

title.children: Foul fatbergs on the rise in Perth's sewers

image.altText: ADHD meds

props.synopsis: Some of the most common medications for ADHD are set to be in short supply until the end of the year, which means plenty of people across Australia may find their pharmacist can't fill their prescriptions.

title.children: Why ADHD meds are in short supply, and what can you do about it

image.altText: Two Palestinian women crying and embracing in a crowd.

props.synopsis: Hamas is seeking guarantees from the US that a ceasefire with Israel will lead to a lasting end to the war.

title.children: Deadly strikes hit Gaza as Israel intensifies campaign

image.altText: A man in dark clothes and sunglasses looking back at the camera

props.synopsis: A Queensland ferry driver nabbed in a police sting while trying to meet a 13-year-old boy has been jailed for his "vile" and "calculated" offending.

title.children: Ferry driver nabbed by police sting trying to meet 13yo boy via Snapchat

image.altText: Brightly coloured frogs in wet veegetation.

props.synopsis: Brindabella National Park has some eye-catching new residents thanks to a Taronga Zoo breeding program.

title.children: Zoo releases critically endangered frogs into NSW national park

image.altText: Oscar Piastri poses with a fan for a selfie photograph during a fan day

props.synopsis: Australia's Formula 1 drivers' championship leader Oscar Piastri says he believes any of the top four teams are in with a chance of victory at Silverstone this weekend.

title.children: Piastri expecting a 'good fight' with multiple drivers in Britain

image.altText: Koren Helbig uses a large pair of tree trimmers on a tree in her garden. She wears a jumper and jeans.

props.synopsis: Winter can feel like a time to avoid the garden, but these simple jobs can help keep things productive through the cooler months and set you up for the warmer ones.

title.children: Five easy winter gardening tasks to lay the groundwork for spring

image.altText: Olivia Rodrigo in a checked dress raises her sunglasses and pouts at her partner

props.synopsis: Here are some of the famous faces spotted in the crowd at Wimbledon, one of the world's most star-studded sports events.

title.children: Olivia Rodrigo and Louis Partridge among famous faces at Wimbledon

image.altText: Woman with brown-yellow hair wearing fitness top and pants smiles with hands behind the square of her back

props.synopsis: The well-connected Melbourne/Naarm singer-songwriter gets candid about her second album, a playful yet mature and very relatable set inspired by a fantasy novel and The Simpsons.

title.children: The novel that inspired Merpire to write the horniest songs of her career

image.altText: A woman with short hair smiles standing in front of a Qantas airplane in a hangar.

props.synopsis: Qantas has sent emails to customers affected or potentially affected by a cyber attack, but it took two days for any of its senior executives to front the media.

title.children: Flying kangaroo goes to ground on data breach

image.altText: A court sketch of Keith Russell Yandle.

props.synopsis: Convicted killer Keith Russell Yandle, whose victim was found buried at a property north of Adelaide in 2023, has been jailed for 32 years over the "calculated, ruthless" shooting murder.

title.children: Killer jailed for 32 years over 'calculated, ruthless' murder

image.altText: Michael Madsen in a black suit jacket and white shirt smiling while standing in front of a black red carpet banner

props.synopsis: Michael Madsen, whose menacing characters in Reservoir Dogs and Kill Bill made him a stand-out in Quentin Tarantino's films, dies aged 67.

title.children: Reservoir Dogs and Kill Bill star Michael Madsen dies at 67

image.altText: A lamb on red dirt with blue sky behind looks towards the camera. Others in the background eating hay.

props.synopsis: Murder mystery North Shore has been in the top 10 shows on Netflix for the past three weeks, but one episode in particular and its discussion of mulesing has farmers up in arms.

title.children: Sheep farmers are furious with a popular drama on Netflix
